user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_session:
```c
static struct Session *
get_session (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  struct Session *ret;
  const char *cookie;

  cookie = MHD_lookup_connection_value (connection,
                                        MHD_COOKIE_KIND,
                                        COOKIE_NAME);
  if (cookie != NULL)
  {
    /* find existing session */
    ret = sessions;
    while (NULL != ret)
    {
      if (0 == strcmp (cookie, ret->sid))
        break;
      ret = ret->next;
    }
    if (NULL != ret)
    {
      ret->rc++;
      return ret;
    }
  }
  /* create fresh session */
  ret = calloc (1, sizeof (struct Session));
  if (NULL == ret)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "calloc error: %s\n", strerror (errno));
    return NULL;
  }
  /* not a super-secure way to generate a random session ID,
     but should do for a simple example... */
  snprintf (ret->sid,
            sizeof (ret->sid),
            "%X%X%X%X",
            (unsigned int) rand (),
            (unsigned int) rand (),
            (unsigned int) rand (),
            (unsigned int) rand ());
  ret->rc++;
  ret->start = time (NULL);
  ret->next = sessions;
  sessions = ret;
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (0 == strcmp (cookie, ret->sid))
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No — not necessarily violated. In this code strcmp(cookie, ret->sid) is safe provided both operands are valid NUL‑terminated character arrays: ret->sid is filled with snprintf(ret->sid, sizeof(ret->sid), ...) (so it is bounded and NUL‑terminated when sizeof(ret->sid) > 0) and cookie is obtained from MHD_lookup_connection_value which (by its API contract) returns a NUL‑terminated C string. Under those assumptions the call does not read beyond object bounds. A violation scenario would occur if either operand is not NUL‑terminated (for example ret->sid was corrupted or previously written without a terminator, or MHD_lookup_connection_value returned a non‑terminated buffer) — then strcmp could read past the buffer and would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17.
